FuncDef:
The redirect interface command configures an action of redirecting packets to an interface in a traffic behavior.
The undo redirect interface command deletes the redirection configuration. The redirect interface command configures an action of redirecting packets to an interface in a traffic behavior. The undo redirect interface command deletes the redirection configuration. By default, the action of redirecting packets to an interface is not configured in a traffic behavior.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the action to be taken when the interface to which packets are redirected is Down.
-

Specifies the ID of a GRE tunnel interface to which packets are redirected.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4095.

Specifies the type of the interface to which packets are redirected.
-

Specifies the number of the interface to which packets are redirected.
-

Specifies the name of the interface to which packets are redirected.
-

Forwards packets according to the original forwarding process.
-

ExtraInfo: You can run the redirect interface command to configure an action of redirecting packets to an interface in a traffic behavior. For example, packets can be redirected to a firewall for security check.
